bullet_summary: Reported by The Age, ABC Just In, 9News

items.title: ‘Inconsistencies’ emerge in case over toddler’s suspicious death
items.standfirst: A 33-year-old man had been accused of killing the boy, but the charges were later dropped.
items.content: A 33-year-old man had been accused of killing the boy, but the charges were later dropped.

items.title: Police identify 'inconsistencies' in 2022 death of toddler north of Brisbane
items.standfirst: Detectives are renewing calls for witnesses as they investigate the suspicious death of a 16-month-old boy in Burpengary in 2022.
items.content: Detectives are renewing calls for witnesses as they investigate the suspicious death of a 16-month-old boy in Burpengary in 2022.

items.title: 'Inconsistencies' found during investigation into toddler's susicious death
items.standfirst: Detectives are renewing their calls for information about the suspicious death of a Queensland toddler in 2022 after discovering "inconsistencies" in information they were initially given.
items.content: Detectives are renewing their calls for information about the suspicious death of a Queensland toddler in 2022 after discovering "inconsistencies" in information they were initially given.A 16-month-old boy was found in a critical condition when paramedics were called to a home at Staaten Street, Burpengary about 2.40pm on December 30, 2021. The toddler was transported to Queensland Children's Hospital in a critical condition before he passed away in hospital on January 8, 2022.READ MORE: 'Inconsistencies' found during investigation into toddler's suspicious death An investigation was initially launched by Pine Rivers Child Protection Investigation Unit in conjunction with Child Trauma Unit and Homicide Investigation Unit.A 33-year-old man was then charged with one count of murder (domestic violence offence) on February 16, 2022. Police have today advised that they have received new information in their investigation."Ongoing investigations have identified a number of inconsistencies from information initially provided," a police statement reads."Investigators are renewing their appeal for anyone who may have witnessed suspicious activity or concerning behaviour in the vicinity of Staaten Street involving a male child in the lead up to Thursday, 30 December 2021 are urged to come forward."National Sexual Assault, Domestic Family Violence Counselling Service 1800RESPECT (1800 737 732).

ai_summary: Police found "inconsistencies" in the death investigation.
The case involves the suspicious death of a toddler in 2022.
A 33-year-old man was accused of killing the boy.
The charges against the man were later dropped.
Detectives are renewing calls for witnesses to come forward.

clusters.title: Ace Frehley, founding member of rock group KISS, dies at 74
clusters.neutral_headline: Ace Frehley, KISS Founding Member, Dies at 74

items.title: Ace Frehley, founding member of rock group KISS, dies at 74
items.standfirst: The original lead guitarist of the glam rock band captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar.
items.content: The original lead guitarist of the glam rock band captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar.

items.title: Rock legend dies aged 74
items.standfirst: A founding member of glam rock icons KISS captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar.
items.content: Ace Frehley, the original lead guitarist and founding member of the glam rock band KISS who captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar, has died. He was 74.The American rock star died peacefully on Thursday (Friday AEDT )surrounded by family in the north-eastern state of New Jersey following a recent fall, according to his agent.Family members said in a statement that they are "completely devastated and heartbroken", but will cherish his laughter and celebrate the kindness he bestowed upon others.READ MORE: Inside Trump and Putin's two-hour phone callKiss, whose hits include Rock and Roll All Nite and Detroit Rock City, was known for its intense stage shows, which included fireworks, smoke and eruptions of fake blood performed by band members in black-and-white painted faces, platform boots and black wigs.Frehley and his band mates were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2014.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: Ace Frehley, a founding member of KISS, has died.

He was 74 years old at the time of his death.

items.title: Micronesia's worst fears realised as WWII shipwrecks leak

The oil leak poses a threat to the environment and tourism.
